communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Stateville (parent facility and NRC) Correctional Center:  

♥ Telephone directory of all current Stateville Correctional Center (parent facility and the NRC) employees and staff.

♥ Email directory of all current Stateville Correctional Center (parent facility and the NRC) employees and staff.

♥ Comprehensive list of current phone numbers, extensions, and corresponding names. If possible, please include position titles of each extension. For example, extension 6600 is Warden  (position title) and directs the caller to David Gomez's (name) office administrator.

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

title: Dixon - REVIEW ADMIN Emails containing "double celling"

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Dixon - REVIEW ADMIN Emails containing "double celling"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Dixon Correctional Center:  

All records related to reviews conducted for double celling and approvals of double celling, consistent with III. Admin. Code tit. 20 § 504.620(a), at Dixon Correctional Center from August 1st, 2023 to October 1st, 2023.

Please note that statute does not allow your agency to withhold documents in their entirety if only parts of the records may be exempt, so please redact prisoners' names and cell numbers but not the entire emails. Please provide redacted emails.

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Lincoln NE

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Lincoln NE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In January 2024 a  man was arrested after police say he rammed a skid-steer loader into several vehicles, including a police cruiser, during a rampage in southeast Lincoln. The 36-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of second-degree assault, second-degree assault of an officer and criminal mischief following the alleged crime spree that began at the U-Stop convenience store near 73rd Street and Pine Lake Road around 2:30 p.m. The man rammed several vehicles with the loader before driving to the Home Depot at 70th Street and Nebraska Parkway — about a third of a mile away — where he drove into more vehicles.

I  am looking for body camera footage from responding officers, incident and investigative reports, 911 call detail logs, use of force reports, and dispatch audio of this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: RE: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Lincoln NE
communications.communication:
Hello Dhruv,

I have forwarded your request to our legal adviser, who is CC'd on this email. Please take this response as acknowledgement of receipt.

Thank you!

Erika Thomas
Public Information Office Manager
Lincoln Police Department
Facebook | X

Cell: 402-805-7469
Email: LPD3627@cjis.lincoln.ne.gov
Hours: 7:30 AM – 4 PM, Monday - Friday

575 S. 10th Street
Lincoln, NE 68508
